The Coming of the Valar and the Building of Valinor

wikitext.*:
'''Orossi''' were the [[fays]] of the mountains, according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, entry '''Orossi''', p. 264</ref><ref>{{PE|14}}, "[[The Creatures of the Earth]]", p. 10</ref>

They arrived to the world with [[Aulë]] and [[Yavanna]], along with many other types of fays.<ref>{{LT1|III}}, p. 66</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Orossi'' is in [[Qenya]], probably being derived from the root [[ORO]] ("steepness, rising"),<ref>{{PE|12}}, entry '''ORO''' (1), p. 70</ref> according to [[Christopher Tolkien]].<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, entries '''Orossi''' and '''Oromë''', p. 264</ref>
